meanings.definition: The movement of a fluid or gas in an upward direction.
meanings.sent1: The upflow of hot air carried the balloon higher into the sky.
meanings.sent2: The upflow of water in the fountain created a beautiful display.
meanings.sent3: The upflow of bubbles in the fish tank made the fish look like they were dancing.
meanings.sent4: The upflow of emotions in the room was palpable as everyone shared their stories.
meanings.sent5: The upflow of energy from the crowd fueled the performers on stage.

meanings.sent1: The bubbles upflowed to the surface of the water.
meanings.sent2: Smoke upflowed from the chimney of the cozy cabin.
meanings.sent3: The laughter upflowed from the children playing in the park.
meanings.sent4: Hope upflowed in her heart as she saw the first signs of spring.
meanings.sent5: Music upflowed from the street performers, filling the square with joy.
